definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt

sentences.english: Buffett invests has a characteristic, that is can insist throughout " counter- corruptly".
sentences.chinese: 巴菲特投资有一个特点，那就是始终能坚持“反贪”。

sentences.english: He is counted as a national hero.
sentences.chinese: 那个国家发起了一场全国性的反贪污运动。

sentences.english: MACC stand for Malaysia Anti-Corruption Commission.
sentences.chinese: 中文就是大马反贪污委员会。

sentences.english: The answer might be in the hands of the 42 Advisory Panel Members of the MACC.
sentences.chinese: 答案或许在反贪委员会42个顾问成员手上。

sentences.english: The public confidence on MACC is at an all time low since the death of Teoh Beng Hock.
sentences.chinese: 赵明福之死使公众对反贪委员会的信心降至最低。

sentences.english: In recent years, China has launched numerous anti-graft campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，中国已经发起了许多次反贪运动。

sentences.english: They are planning a new campaign against corruption in Bioengineering.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在策划一个新的生物工程学的反贪污运动。

sentences.english: It looks very bad for a government that has fashioned itself as the 'anti-corruption' government.
sentences.chinese: 对这标榜著反贪污的政府来说，看来非常糟糕。

sentences.english: They launched a new campaign against corruption.
sentences.chinese: 他们发动了新的反贪污运动。

sentences.english: They are planning a new campaign against corruption.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在策划一个新的反贪污运动。

sentences.english: An official of the anti-graft body will also face administrative sanction.
sentences.chinese: 反贪机构的一名官员也将面临行政处分。

definition: to fight corruption and advocate probity
public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)
Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (CCDI), organization within the CCP which investigates corruption and other wrongdoing among Party cadres/abbr. for 中共中央紀律檢查委員會|中共中央纪律检查委员会
